channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration.

item.title: Report E-2025020366
item.description:
Report E-2025020366

Identified by scraper @ 2025-02-28T00:58:02+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-02-14
  • City: BLAKESBURG
  • State: IA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: W2 LOGISTIC INC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 50000
  • Serious Incident Ind: Yes
  • Description: On February 14, 2025, a W2 Logistic, Inc tractor trailer was involved in a motor vehicle incident that resulted in a cargo release. The trailer was hauling various drums and totes of non-hazardous, non-regulated, and hazardous UN1760, Corrosive liquids. Approximately 300-500-gallons of various products released to the environment. Local authorities, Mike Lamb from Emergency Management & Homeland Security, and Deran’s Towing Service were on site. Transportation Spill Solutions (TSS) reviewed the report from the Fire Department. According to the report, Mike Lamb and the Fire Department’s Hazmat Team conducted the initial cleanup of the release. The FD indicated that there (3) 55-gallon drums, (3) 250-gallon totes, and (2) 5-gallon buckets near the nose of the trailer. Only (2) 250-gallon totes and (1) 55-gallon drum was leaking inside the trailer. There were (4) 55-gallon drums and (1) 250-gallon tote outside the trailer. FD transferred material into (1) 55-gallon drum, (2) 95-gallon drums, (2) 65-gallon drums, and (1) 35-gallon drum. There was also a hydraulic oil release that was cleaned. All drums were labelled and staged on the side of the roadway.

item.title: Report E-2025020248
item.description:
Report E-2025020248

Identified by scraper @ 2025-02-23T00:59:57+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-02-13
  • City: MONTROSE
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPRESS NATURAL GAS LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Fitting on lower right hand tank to Fire Protection system valve vibrated loose and caused system to lose pressure. This vented the entire trailer until 3 of the 4 islation valves were closed and the bottom right hand tank completely vented.

item.title: Report E-2025020249
item.description:
Report E-2025020249

Identified by scraper @ 2025-02-23T00:59:57+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-01-24
  • City: PINEHURST
  • State: NC
  • Report Type: A specification cargo tank 1,000 gallons or greater containing any hazardous materials that (1) received structural damage to the lading retention system or damage that requires repair to a system int
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: MCNEILL OIL COMPANY, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 37600
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Driver was traveling north on SR 1115. Vehicle traveled off the roadway to the right, struck a ditch, traveled across the roadway, struck a phone box/pole, trees and overturned on its side. The truck came to rest on the shoulder upside down. Only liquid and vapor trapped in the piping of the CTMV were released. After arrival on scene from both County Hazmat and Company representatives, it was determined that flaring off the remaining hazmat in a controlled burn was the best resolution in order to tow the CTMV.

item.title: Report E-2025020247
item.description:
Report E-2025020247

Identified by scraper @ 2025-02-23T00:59:57+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-01-22
  • City: MARS HILL
  • State: ME
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPRESS NATURAL GAS LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: Yes
  • Description: Trailer was in line to unload and while waiting to decant. Temps were below 0 deg F. The normally open fire protection system lost supply pressure due to a frozen 1/4" swagelok tube blockage from frozen oil. All 4 cyclinders vented. The required consistant supply pressure was at 0 psig from a normal 90-100 psig supply the the FPS system fed off the bottom right hand tank

  • Serious Incident Ind: Yes
  • Description: Driver filled tank at customer site and did not attach vapor return lines. This caused the tank to be over pressurized and material to leak out of the tank.

item.title: Report I-2025020022
item.description:
Report I-2025020022

Identified by scraper @ 2025-02-23T00:59:57+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-01-02
  • City: Woodlawn
  • State: RI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: CARPATHIAN WAY INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: Yes
  • Description: I Responded to a single vehicle rollover involving a CMV hauling HAZMAT. The CMV left the roadway, overcorrected, and rolled onto the passenger side. See C10-25-00003 for further details. The jarring from exiting/reentering the roadway, and rolling onto its side, caused the product being shipping to rupture/leak from the trailer. Several Fire Departments responded to the scene, along with MABAS HAZMAT Crew, to contain the spill. Initially, a 100 meter exclusionary zone was established for safety. The crews placed yellow boom in and around the trailer to contain the spill. E-Environmental Solutions was contacted to mitigate the spill. Until deemed safe the estimated duration of release was 2 hours. IBCs appeared to have leaked out of the filler cap due to the overturn- no overt damage observable. Load is intermittently reacting with the atmosphere(emitting gas vapors)- unable to ascertain Ieakage from IBC's in nose of trailer. The lane closure will continue until mitigation completed

item.title: Report E-2025020246
item.description:
Report E-2025020246

Identified by scraper @ 2025-02-23T00:59:57+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-12-27
  • City: LITTLETON
  • State: ME
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPRESS NATURAL GAS LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: Yes
  • Description: Trailer was statonary at Westerdhals Garage in Littleton, ME for chassis issue repair. Temps dropped into single digits and the normally open fire protection system lost supply pressure due to a frozen 1/4" swagelok tube blockage from frozen oil. Only the top left tank vented and the other three started to open. XNG was able to secure and lock out the other 3. The consistant supply pressure was at 20 psig from a normal 90-100 psig supply the the FPS system fed off the bottom right hand tank

item.title: Report E-2025010193
item.description:
Report E-2025010193

Identified by scraper @ 2025-02-23T00:59:57+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-12-18
  • City: GALLIPOLIS
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: J. B. HUNT TRANSPORT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 1
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 22000
  • Serious Incident Ind: Yes
  • Description: Hepaco arrived onsite and observed an area measuring approximately 200ft-by-25ft impacted by released diesel fuel and Nyquil due to a fatal multi-vehicle accident that closed the highway for multiple hours. Hepaco personnel deployed absorbent boom and used absorbent pads to prevent migration of the released materials and then the site was secured for remediation. Hepaco returned to the site four days later to excavate the impacted area. Five 55-gallon metal drums of soil contaminated with diesel and Nyquil were generated. The generated waste was transported offsite for disposal.
